metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6273 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the HTTP transport code in apt-get in APT 1.0.1 and earlier allows man-in-the-middle attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6273` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apt - 1.0.1ubuntu2.4.1
apt-transport-https - 1.0.1ubuntu2.4.1
apt-utils - 1.0.1ubuntu2.4.1
libapt-inst1.5 - 1.0.1ubuntu2.4.1
libapt-pkg4.12 - 1.0.1ubuntu2.4.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> should only be a denial of service because of hardening

criterions.comment: apt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1ubuntu2.4.1').
